articles.content:

articles.title: The first experimental realization of a dissipative time crystal - Phys.org
articles.description: A time crystal is a unique and exotic phase of matter first predicted by the American physicist Frank Wilczek in 2012. Time crystals are temporal analogs of more conventional space crystals, as both are based on structures characterized by repeating patterns.
